snippet: Glum-looking detainees, often stripped to their underwear, can be seen around Donetsk digging ditches, clearing brush and peeling potatoes.
abstract: Ukraine military is using forced labor of drunks, drug addicts and curfew violators as one of its weapons of defense in Donetsk, which is now isolated by siege; detainee crews dig ditches, clear brush and fill sandbags, while more serious violations have been met with summary executions.

byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Glum-looking detainees, often stripped to their underwear, can be seen around Donetsk digging ditches, clearing brush and peeling potatoes.

headline.main: Ukraine Rebels Conscript ‘Punishment Brigades’ for Support Work
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Rebels Enlisting ‘Punishment Brigades’ for Support Work
